intro: Licania subrotundata, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its large, waxy, yellowish-green leaves that are oval in shape. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. Licania subrotundata is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Its unique leaf structure and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for horticultural use in certain regions.
